column4: When I'm logging in, the mouse settings are set to default. This is annoying because I'm expecting the cursor to move faster because I set the cursor acceleration to be faster.
Did you run something as root? Could be a permissions issue where it can't save the settings
the settings are saved when I log in. It's only at the login screen does the mouse settings return to their defaults.
The settings can probably be setup from xorg.conf Input section, but if it doesn't justwork, its likely a bug in the device driver module for your trackpad
what am I looking for in this log file?
what does a log file have to do with my issue? :\
X is the one that configures the device. If it's not a driver problem but a configuration one, you should be able to set it up in xorg.conf
It's stored in /etc/X11/ though recent versions of X are smart enough to guess what configuration is needed so no xorg.conf is installed by default
so I just create a text file called xorg.conf in /etc/X11
Yes, if the file exists, the settings will be respected if it can parse it
what sort of settings can I put in this configuration file?
That is really beyond the scope of this channel.. you might try googling though (you basically would just define and Input section )
